A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This has the ignomy of being the first Star Wars film I did not walk out of the cinema feeling exhilirated and excited for the next installment. 

A second viewing helped me enjoy it for what it was\, but still so ulitmately disappointing. 

I have no reason to care about what's next for these characthers and given Rian Johnson's track record for films that I've really enjoyed\, this was underwhelming.  

The motif of the film was to 'let the past die' and I find it very interesting that ther original Star Wars generation have been despondent about the latest entry\, whereby the younger audience have more positively recieved it.  

I would dearly love to praise this film blindly\, but it's flawed in so many places. I totally get why Rian Johnson took his own direction of the Star Wars films\, but ultimately it didnt hit the notes to resonate with me.

Positives were:

Beautiful cinematography.
Strong female figures\, we need more of these!
Mark Hamill's best ever performance as Luke.

Things that I really didn't like:

Mary Leia Poppins
DJ - What was the point? Echoes of Lando with no redemption.
Hux - Turned into a figure of fun and denotes no threat
Phasma\, was she really that busy filming GOT S7? A strong female villain taken out for a gag.
World's slowest car/spaceship chase and the logic behind it.

I'm hoping repeat viewings will find me more to love about it in the nuances\, but for now I'm just hoping JJ Abrahams can bring things to a satisfying resolution in Episode 9.
